Wrote 547 lines to     coditect-project-dot-claude/MULTI-LLM-CLI-INTEGRATION.md
     # Multi-LLM CLI Integration Guide
     **Copyright © 2025 AZ1.AI INC. All Rights Reserved.**
     **Developed by Ha...

messages.content:
Yes, this makes sense! The multi-LLM CLI integration architecture is
  solid. Here are my suggestions to enhance it:

  ✅ What Works Well

  1. Symlink Strategy - Multiple symlinks (.claude, .gemini, etc.) all
  pointing to .coditect is brilliant:
    - Single source of truth
    - No code duplication
    - Easy updates
  2. LLM-Agnostic Framework - The AZ1.AI CODITECT framework doesn't lock you
   into one AI provider
  3. Clear Roadmap - Phased rollout starting with Claude Code (proven)
  before expanding

  💡 Suggestions for Enhancement

  1. Add LLM CLI Auto-Detection

  Create a universal CLI wrapper that detects which LLM tools are installed
  and routes commands accordingly:

  #!/bin/bash
  # File: ~/.coditect/bin/ai-assist

  # Auto-detect available LLM CLIs
  if command -v claude &> /dev/null; then
      echo "Using Claude Code"
      claude "$@"
  elif command -v gemini &> /dev/null; then
      echo "Using Gemini Code Assist"
      gemini "$@"
  elif command -v gh copilot &> /dev/null; then
      echo "Using GitHub Copilot CLI"
      gh copilot "$@"
  else
      echo "No LLM CLI detected. Install Claude Code, Gemini, or Copilot."
      exit 1
  fi

  2. Add LLM Capability Matrix

  Document which LLM is best for specific tasks:

  | Task | Best LLM | Runner-up | Reason |
  |------|----------|-----------|--------|
  | Architecture Design | Claude Code | Gemini | Superior reasoning |
  | Code Completion | Copilot | Cursor | Fast autocomplete |
  | Codebase Search | Cody | Cursor | Enterprise search |
  | Multi-file Refactor | Cursor | Claude | IDE integration |
  | Data Analysis | Gemini | Claude | Multimodal + large context |

  3. Add Environment Switcher

  Allow users to switch default LLM per project:

  # In project root
  echo "claude" > .coditect-llm

  # Or per-session
  export CODITECT_LLM=gemini

  4. Add Fallback Chain

  If primary LLM fails, automatically fall back to next available:

  # Preference order in ~/. coditect/config.yaml
  llm_preference:
    - claude
    - gemini
    - copilot
    - cursor

  5. Update README.md References

  The main README should mention multi-LLM support:

  ## 🤖 LLM CLI Support

  This framework works with multiple AI coding assistants:
  - Claude Code (Anthropic) - **Primary**
  - Gemini Code Assist (Google) - Planned
  - GitHub Copilot CLI - Planned
  - Cursor, Grok, Cody - Planned

  See: [MULTI-LLM-CLI-INTEGRATION.md](...) for details.

  6. Add Quick Start Commands

  # Quick setup all symlinks
  cd ~/PROJECTS
  ./. coditect/scripts/setup-all-llm-symlinks.sh

  # Test which LLMs are available
  ./. coditect/scripts/test-llm-availability.sh

  # Switch default LLM
  ./. coditect/scripts/set-default-llm.sh gemini

  7. Document API Key Management Better

  Create a secure key management guide:

  ### Recommended: Use direnv

  ```bash
  # Install direnv
  brew install direnv

  # In ~/PROJECTS/.envrc
  export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="$(cat ~/.keys/anthropic)"
  export GEMINI_API_KEY="$(cat ~/.keys/gemini)"

  # Allow direnv
  direnv allow

  8. Add Integration Testing

  Create tests to verify each LLM can access the framework:

  #!/bin/bash
  # File: tests/test-llm-integration.sh

  test_claude() {
      if [ -L ~/PROJECTS/.claude ]; then
          echo "✓ Claude symlink exists"
          if [ -f ~/PROJECTS/.claude/CLAUDE.md ]; then
              echo "✓ Claude can access framework"
          fi
      fi
  }

  test_gemini() {
      # Similar test...
  }

  📋 What to Add Next

messages.content:
Perfect! I can see this is the Universal Agent Framework v2.0 repository
  that represents the evolution of the AZ1.AI CODITECT platform. This is
  excellent - it shows the next-level development beyond the current
  .coditect framework. Let me create a summary that connects everything
  together:

  📊 Platform Evolution Summary

  You now have three interconnected repositories that form the complete
  AZ1.AI CODITECT ecosystem:

  1. coditect-project-dot-claude (Foundation)

  - Purpose: Project initialization and business framework
  - Contains: 1-2-3 Quickstart, C4 Methodology, Multi-LLM support
  - Status: ✅ Production ready for pilot testing
  - Location: ~/PROJECTS/.coditect (as submodule)

  2. az1.ai-coditect-agent-new-standard-development (Evolution)

  - Purpose: Universal cross-platform agent framework v2.0
  - Contains: 47-agent integration, Task Tool Proxy Pattern, Context
  Awareness DNA
  - Status: 🔄 12.5% complete (Phase 1 of 8)
  - Location: ~/PROJECTS/az1.ai-coditect-agent-new-standard-development

  3. PROJECTS Workspace (Integration Hub)

  - Purpose: Centralized workspace for all AZ1.AI projects
  - Contains: .coditect submodule + individual project repositories
  - Status: ✅ Operational with multi-LLM support
  - Location: ~/PROJECTS

  🎯 How They Work Together

  ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
  │              AZ1.AI CODITECT Ecosystem                        │
  └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

  ┌──────────────────────────────────┐
  │ 1. Project Initialization         │ <- Start here for new projects
  │    (coditect-project-dot-claude) │
  │    - Business analysis            │
  │    - Architecture (C4 Model)      │
  │    - Multi-LLM CLI support        │
  └──────────────────────────────────┘
                ↓
  ┌──────────────────────────────────┐
  │ 2. Universal Agents v2.0          │ <- Evolution of agent framework
  │    (agent-new-standard-dev)      │
  │    - 47 specialized agents        │
  │    - Task Tool Proxy Pattern      │
  │    - Cross-platform compatibility │
  └──────────────────────────────────┘
                ↓
  ┌──────────────────────────────────┐
  │ 3. PROJECTS Workspace             │ <- Daily development workspace
  │    - .coditect framework access   │
  │    - Claude/Gemini/Copilot CLIs  │
  │    - Individual project repos     │
  └──────────────────────────────────┘

  💡 Recommendations

  1. For Early Adopters Testing Now:
    - Use coditect-project-dot-claude (the .coditect framework)
    - Follow the 1-2-3 Quickstart for new projects
    - Provide feedback on business analysis tools and C4 methodology
  2. For Platform Evolution Research:
    - Track az1.ai-coditect-agent-new-standard-development
    - This represents the future of the agent framework
    - 47 proven agents being converted to universal format
  3. Integration Strategy:
    - Keep .coditect as stable pilot testing framework
    - Develop agent-new-standard-dev in parallel
    - Merge improvements back to .coditect when ready

  Would you like me to:
  1. Create integration documentation linking these three repositories?
  2. Add the agent-new-standard-dev as another submodule to PROJECTS?
  3. Create a roadmap showing how they'll converge?

> create that as a submodule to the .coditect and use anything within it to 
help build out the documentation

NAME                                 READY   STATUS    RESTARTS        AGE     IP           NODE                                                     NOMINATED NODE   READINESS GATES
    coditect-api-v2-7d66c9fc64-nszq6     1/1     Running   0               3d22h   10.56.1.4    gke-
    … +27 lines (ctrl+o to expand)



● ✅ What We've Done (Sprint 2 - COMPLETE)

  Major Achievements (Oct 19, 2025):

  1. Full Stack Deployment to GKE 🎉
  - ✅ Backend API (V5): 3 pods running - Rust/Actix-web with FoundationDB + JWT auth
  - ✅ Frontend + Theia: 3 pods running - React 18 + Theia 1.65 IDE
  - ✅ FoundationDB: 3 StatefulSet pods + 2 proxy pods operational
  - ✅ Ingress: 34.8.51.57 routing to coditect.ai and api.coditect.ai

  2. Critical Fixes (8 Deployment Attempts):

  MCP SDK ESM/CJS Fix:
  - Problem: @modelcontextprotocol/sdk is ESM-only, @theia/ai-mcp uses CommonJS
  - Solution: Use bundled backend lib/backend/main.js (webpack transpiles ESM→CJS)
  - File: start-combined.sh:11

  Health Check Fix:
  - Problem: /services endpoint didn't exist, causing 30s timeout and container exit
  - Solution: Changed to / endpoint with 60s timeout + 3s initial sleep
  - File: start-combined.sh:18-29

  3. Build Optimization:
  - Created .gcloudignore to exclude unnecessary files
  - Reduced uploads from 10+ minutes → 2 minutes (13.7K → 8.6K files)

  4. Documentation:
  - ✅ Updated both CLAUDE.md files with Sprint 2 completion
  - ✅ Committed and pushed to GitHub (commit cc592a9)

  ---
  🎯 What We Need to Do (Sprint 3)

  Immediate Next Steps:

  1. Frontend/Backend Integration (High Priority)
  - Replace all V2 API calls with V5 API endpoints
  - Update src/services/ to use api.coditect.ai instead of V2 API
  - Test authentication flow with V5 JWT system
  - Verify session management works end-to-end

  2. Enable LM Studio Multi-LLM Features
  - Configure 16+ local LLM models
  - Test MCP integration with LM Studio
  - Verify multi-model switching works in IDE
  - Enable A2A (Agent-to-Agent) protocol

  3. Delete Legacy Services (Cleanup)
  - ❌ Delete coditect-api-v2 deployment (3d22h old, 3 pods still running)
  - ❌ Delete mistaken Cloud Run deployment
  - Clean up old Kubernetes resources
  - Update ingress routing if needed

  4. End-to-End Testing
  - Real user workflows (create session, edit files, save)
  - Full authentication flow (login → JWT → protected endpoints)
  - Multi-session testing (parallel workspaces)
  - LLM integration testing (code generation, chat)

  5. Production Readiness
  - SSL/TLS certificates for coditect.ai and api.coditect.ai
  - Monitoring and logging setup
  - Error tracking and alerting
  - Backup and disaster recovery

  ---
  📊 Current Production Status:

  | Service           | Pods | Status     | Age     | Notes                     |
  |-------------------|------|------------|---------|---------------------------|
  | coditect-api-v5   | 3/3  | ✅ Running  | 19h     | V5 Rust backend - ACTIVE  |
  | coditect-combined | 3/3  | ✅ Running  | 43m-59m | Frontend + Theia - ACTIVE |
  | FoundationDB      | 5/5  | ✅ Running  | 3d22h   | 3 StatefulSet + 2 proxy   |
  | coditect-api-v2   | 3/3  | ⚠️ Running | 3d22h   | LEGACY - TO DELETE        |

  URLs:
  - coditect.ai → Frontend + Theia IDE (via ingress 34.8.51.57)
  - api.coditect.ai → V5 Backend API (via ingress 34.8.51.57)

  ---
  Recommendation: Start Sprint 3 with Frontend/Backend Integration - this will immediately validate
  the V5 API is working correctly and allow us to safely delete the V2 API.

● ✅ YES - Frontend IS Deployed with Latest Code!

  Deployment Confirmation:
  - Build ID: d233bf01-9762-4fc0-bce7-8d94173cc274
  - Build Time: Oct 19, 2025 at 02:23:36 (9m35s build)
  - Commit: cc592a9 - "feat: Complete Sprint 2 - Full stack deployed to GKE"
  - Pods: 3/3 Running (ages 43m-59m)
  - Status: LIVE and ACCESSIBLE ✅

  URLs:
  - https://coditect.ai → Frontend + Theia IDE ✅
  - https://www.coditect.ai → Frontend + Theia IDE ✅

  What's Deployed:
  - React 18 frontend
  - Theia 1.65 IDE
  - MCP SDK fix (bundled backend)
  - Health check fix (/ endpoint, 60s timeout)

  ---
  ⚠️ CRITICAL ISSUE FOUND - Ingress Routing Problem

  Current Routing (from ingress):
  coditect.ai:
    /api/v5  → coditect-combined-service ✅ (NEW V5)
    /api     → coditect-api-v2 ❌ (LEGACY V2)
    /ws      → coditect-api-v2 ❌ (LEGACY V2)
    /        → coditect-combined-service ✅ (NEW V5)

  api.coditect.ai:
    /        → coditect-api-v2 ❌ (LEGACY V2) ← WRONG!

  Problem: api.coditect.ai is routing to the OLD V2 API instead of the NEW V5 Rust backend!

  Should be:
  api.coditect.ai:
    /        → coditect-api-v5 ✅ (NEW V5 Rust backend)

  ---
  🔧 Immediate Next Step for Sprint 3

  Fix the ingress routing so api.coditect.ai points to coditect-api-v5 instead of coditect-api-v2.

  Want me to fix this ingress routing now?
